byline.contributor: Mohammed Ali Kalfood reported from Sana, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo.
byline.original: By MOHAMMED ALI KALFOOD and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Saudi and Yemeni officials confirm that military coalition led by Saudis conducted airstrikes on international airport in Sana, which have rendered airport inoperable; destruction of airport's runways was meant to prevent Iranian plane from landing, revealing degree to which conflict in country is solidifying into proxy war between Saudi Arabia and Iran.
lead_paragraph: At least seven airstrikes possibly crippled the main runway on Tuesday to prevent an Iranian airplane from landing, according to Saudi and Yemeni officials.

headline.main: Saudis Hit a Yemeni Airport, Possibly Closing Aid Route
headline.print_headline: Saudis Hit Airport in Yemen, Possibly Closing Aid Route

snippet: At least seven airstrikes possibly crippled the main runway on Tuesday to prevent an Iranian airplane from landing, according to Saudi and Yemeni officials.
